com.nxp.id.jcopx
Class UID

java.lang.Object
  com.nxp.id.jcopx.UID

public final class UID
extends java.lang.Object

Class to provide UID functionality. The contained methods can be used to:

  • Get the static UID from the devices security row
  • Enable a random UID for devices in Mifare configuration A

Method Summary
static boolean enableRandomUID()
          Enable random UID for contactless activation in Mifare configuration A.
static boolean enableRandomUID(byte[] key, short offset)
          Deprecated. A password is no longer required. Use enableRandomUID() instead.
static void getStaticUID(byte[] dest, short offset)
          Get the static UID from devices security row.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

enableRandomUID

public static boolean enableRandomUID()
                               throws javacardx.external.ExternalException
Enable random UID for contactless activation in Mifare configuration A. Once this functionality has been activated, it cannot be set back to normal UID mode. Note: The UID returned in random UID mode is always a single UID with a length of four byte. No matter what UID has been configured in the devices security row before. Random UID functionality is not available on devices in Mifare configuration B1 or B4. If this method gets called on such devices, the return value will be false. Since JCOP version 2.4.2 R0 an authentication password is no longer required.

Returns:
true if the activation was successful, false otherwise
Throws:
javacardx.external.ExternalException - with reason code ExternalException.INVALID_PARAM if the random UID cannot be enabled due to an internal error.

enableRandomUID

public static boolean enableRandomUID(byte[] key,
                                      short offset)
                               throws javacardx.external.ExternalException
Deprecated. A password is no longer required. Use enableRandomUID() instead.

Enable the random UID of a card.

Parameters:
key - random UID password
offset - offset of the first byte of the password
Returns:
true if the activation was successful, false otherwise
Throws:
javacardx.external.ExternalException

getStaticUID

public static void getStaticUID(byte[] dest,
                                short offset)
                         throws javacardx.external.ExternalException,
                                java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                java.lang.NullPointerException
Get the static UID from devices security row. This method always returns the devices static UID from security row. No matter what UID activation is configured on contactless activation. (i.e. even for devices in Mifare configuration A with random UID enabled, the static UID from security row is returned.

Parameters:
dest - destination buffer to which the UID gets copied. The buffer must provide space for at least eight byte.
offset - of the first byte in dest.
Throws:
javacardx.external.ExternalException - with reason code ExternalException.INTERNAL_ERROR in case of an internal error.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the destination buffer does not provide enough space.
java.lang.NullPointerException - in case the destination buffer is null
Since:
JCOP 2.4.2 R0
